alert.note: Alert for Hudson (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 19 at 12:41AM EST until further notice by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of northeast New Jersey, including the following counties, Bergen and Hudson and southeast New York, including the following county, Rockland. * WHEN...Until 600 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1235 AM EST, gauge reports from the Hackensack River at Rivervale and New Milford indicated minor to moderate flooding still occurring. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Hackensack River, Berrys Creek, Passaic River, Hirshfeld Brook, Sawmill Creek, Tenakill Brook, Mill Creek, Losen Slofe, Cromakill Creek, Sparkill Creek, Cherry Brook, Herring Brook and Overpeck Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bergenfield, Ridgefield, Pearl River, Oradell, Teaneck, Dumont, New Milford, Ridgefield Park, River Edge, Westwood, Little Ferry, River Vale, Bogota, Emerson, Old Tappan, Harrington Park, West Nyack and Haworth. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
